alert.note: Alert for Little River (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:31AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Little River, southern McCurtain, Franklin, western Bowie, Upshur, Titus, Smith, northwestern Cass, Wood, Morris, Camp, northwestern Cherokee and Red River Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 630 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Idabel to 7 miles south of Athens. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Mount Pleasant, Whitehouse, Gilmer, New Boston, Mineola, Pittsburg, Winnsboro, Clarksville, Foreman, Hagansport, Leesburg, Boxelder, Idabel, Lindale, Mount Vernon, Daingerfield, Bullard, Quitman and De Kalb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
